data.title: Ohio Northern University Diversity: Racial Demographics & Other Stats
data.meta_description: Explore Ohio Northern University diversity statistics including racial demographics, ethnicity, gender ratio, undergrad enrollment, average ages of students and other ONU student population stats.

ONU Demographics & Diversity Report

Below Average Overall DiversityBelow Average Racial-Ethnic DiversityBelow Average Male/Female Diversity

How diverse is Ohio Northern University? College Factual's <nil> diversity report reveals the facts about diversity at ONU. We analyzed racial demographics, gender ratios, student age ranges, and more.

Student PopulationRacial/Ethnic DiversityMale/Female DiversityLocation DiversityStudent Age Diversity

ONU Student Population

2,817 Total Students2,037 Undergraduates681 Graduate Students

How Many Students Attend Ohio Northern University?

ONU total enrollment is approximately 2,817 students. 2,037 are undergraduates and 681 are graduate students.

ONU Undergraduate Population

Male/Female Breakdown of Undergraduates

The full-time ONU undergraduate population is made up of 44% women, and 56% men.

For the gender breakdown for all students, go here.

ONU Racial/Ethnic Breakdown of Undergraduates

See racial/ethnic breakdown for all students.

ONU Graduate Student Population

Male/Female Breakdown of Graduate Students

About 59% of full-time grad students are women, and 41% men.

For the gender breakdown for all students, go here.

ONU Racial-Ethnic Breakdown of Graduate Students

See racial/ethnic breakdown for all students.

Racial/Ethnic Diversity

11% Racial-Ethnic Minorities *Low Faculty Racial/Ethnic Diversity

ONU Racial Demographics:

Low Racial/Ethnic Diversity Among Faculty

Ohio Northern University Faculty Racial/Ethnic Demographics:

Learn more about the faculty at ONU.

ONU Male/Female Diversity

More Male StudentsMore Female Teachers

This school is more popular with men than with women.

There are approximately 1,353 female students and 1,464 male students at ONU.

Even Balance of Male & Female Teachers

Reporting of the gender of ONU is unknown or unavailable.

Faculty Gender Ratio Â 93.62 out of 100.

There are more female teachers than male teachers at this school.

More about ONU faculty.

There are approximately 350 female teachers and 308 male teachers.

Average Geographic Diversity

22.39% Out of State0.67% Out of the Country

ONU ranks 893 out of 2,183 when it comes to geographic diversity.

22.39% of ONU students come from out of state, and 0.67% come from out of the country.

Student Location Diversity Â 59 out of 100.

The undergraduate student body is split among 24 states (may include Washington D.C.). Click on the map for more detail.

Top 5 States

International Students at ONU

Students from 20 countries are represented at this school, with the majority of the international students coming from Japan, Saudi Arabia, and China.

Learn more about international students at ONU.

Above Average Student Age Diversity

Above Average Student Age Diversity68.10% Traditional College Age

The age diversity score this school received indicates it is doing a good job attracting students of all ages.

Student Age Diversity Â 64.00 out of 100.

A traditional college student is defined as being between the ages of 18-21. At ONU, 68.10% of students fall into that category, compared to the national average of 60%.

Notes and References

Footnotes

*The racial-ethnic minorities count is calculated by taking the total number of students and subtracting white students, international students, and students whose race/ethnicity was unknown. This number is then divided by the total number of students at the school to obtain the racial-ethnic minorities percentage.

References
